messages.message: Hey! this continues to be an issue for my team, so let me create a PRODENG ticket to track.

I would take a look at https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1728476527550989 if my suggestion isn't working -- can you help link the specific errors you're seeing? The ticket indicates that we can't resolve to external urls in general, but that isn't the case, we just can't seem to resolve the azure endpoint :slightly_smiling_face:

Adding `nameserver 8.8.8.8` broke the connection between services, specifically `server-nginx` was erroring and rabbitmq wasn't being accessed anymore. @jordy.vlan encountered the same issue, I believe. Could it be that overwriting the dns replaced the kubernetes DNS

> Could it be that overwriting the dns replaced the kubernetes DNS
This would only affect environments using intercepted services, I thought you were using `ppy` based on the thread from earlier today?

:ack:  should be unrelated to kubernetes then -- do you have some nginx logs you can share so I can see what errors you're getting? `rabbitmq` is indeed a special hostname provided by crafting, however we can work around that by modifying `/etc/hosts`
